resources.string:
Modes:
 1. File recognition (standard, submit/query): upload after recording complete; slower than flash mode but supports Doubao ASR 2.0; recommended when streaming is disabled.
 2. File recognition (flash): upload after recording complete; faster speed but does not support Doubao ASR 2.0.
 3. Streaming (default): upload while recording; returns the final result quickly after stop; no incremental preview. Now supports Doubao ASR 2.0.
 4. Bidirectional streaming (best experience): upload while recording with real-time incremental preview; lower first/last token latency; requires a stable network. Now supports Doubao ASR 2.0.
Uses file recognition mode. The entire recording is sent at once after completion. Suitable for unstable network conditions.
Uses WebSocket streaming recognition. Transcription starts in real-time as you speak, providing faster feedback. Requires stable network connection.
Audio is uploaded in real-time during recording, but results are returned only after recording ends. Faster than file mode; slightly better accuracy than bidirectional mode.
Uses bidirectional streaming. Intermediate results are displayed in real-time as you speak, with faster response times.
Outputs raw recognition results without additional processing.
Enables semantic smoothing to automatically optimize expression and formatting of recognition results. Experimental feature.
The entire audio is treated as one sentence for recognition.
Uses Voice Activity Detection to automatically segment long audio into multiple sentences. Effect needs further testing.
Real-time optimization of transcription results during streaming recognition.
Waits for stable recognition results before displaying text.
Prioritizes displaying the first character quickly to reduce perceived latency.
Uses file recognition (flash mode) after recording completion. Faster speed but does not support Doubao ASR 2.0.
Uses file recognition (standard, submit/query) after recording completion. Slower than flash mode but supports Doubao ASR 2.0 for better accuracy.
Uses Doubao ASR 1.0 model. Compatible with earlier API versions.
Uses Doubao ASR 2.0 model (default). Better recognition accuracy and more language support.
